title: Protests in Iran spread amid deep discontent over economic duress
summary: Students have joined protests prompted by plummeting currency as government pledges to listen to legitimate concerns.

title: Displacement camps swell with people fleeing Sudan’s war-ravaged el-Fasher
summary: Satellites show one camp spanning 500,000 square metres near the city of al-Dabba, as tens of thousands seek refuge.

title: An A-Z list of 2025’s biggest stories
summary: From artificial intelligence to Zohran Mamdani, Al Jazeera compiles an A-Z list of 2025's biggest stories.

title: LIVE: Israel’s ban on aid groups to have ‘horrific’ outcomes in Gaza
summary: Dozens of humanitarian organisations, including Doctors Without Borders, are banned by Israel.

title: After the floods of 2025, can we keep 2026 above water?
summary: Flooding has become the world's 'foremost climate hazard', according to experts. So what do we do about it?

title: Thailand releases Cambodian soldiers as ceasefire holds
summary: Thailand has released 18 ‍Cambodian soldiers ‍it had detained since July, after the two countries agreed to a ceasefire.

title: China calls on Netherlands to correct ‘mistake’ over chipmaker Nexperia
summary: The Chinese and Dutch governments are at loggerheads over control of chipmaker amid concerns for global supply chains.

title: Russia deploys hypersonic Oreshnik missiles in Belarus amid Europe tensions
summary: Moscow has positioned nuclear-capable hypersonic missiles in Belarus as tensions rise in Europe.

title: How Pakistan’s Asim Munir became Trump’s ‘favourite field marshal’
summary: The army chief, analysts say, has driven Pakistan's geopolitical reemergence over the past year as a soldier-diplomat.

title: Germany hunts Christmas thieves after Ocean’s Eleven-style bank heist
summary: Police are searching for suspects after thieves stole cash, gold and jewels worth up to $105m.

title: Thailand releases 18 Cambodian soldiers as ceasefire holds
summary: Thailand hands over 18 soldiers after 155 days of captivity as truce agreed over the weekend continues to hold.

title: Russia-Ukraine war: List of key events, day 1,406
summary: These are the key developments from day 1,406 of Russia’s war on Ukraine.

title: Séparatistes au Yémen : qui sont-ils, que veulent-ils et pourquoi leur progression change la donne
summary: Au Yémen, un nouvel acteur s’impose. En quelques semaines, les séparatistes du Conseil de transition du Sud ont conquis de vastes territoires stratégiques du pays. Soutenus par Abu Dhabi, accusés de menace par Riyad, ils fragilisent un peu plus un pays déjà morcelé par la guerre. Explications de Franck Mermier, anthropologue et directeur de recherche émérite au CNRS, spécialiste du Yémen.

title: Syrie : couvre-feu à Lattaquié après des violences contre la communauté alaouite
summary: Un couvre-feu est entré en vigueur mardi après-midi à Lattaquié, ville côtière de l'ouest de la Syrie, au lendemain d'une attaque dans des quartiers à majorité alaouite. Selon l'OSDH, un alaouite a été tué, tandis que la télévision d'État rapporte l'arrestation de 21 personnes "appartenant aux vestiges de l'ancien régime".

title: Au Yémen, l’Arabie saoudite bombarde pour rappeler ses "alliés" à l’ordre
summary: Le bombardement par l'Arabie saoudite de la ville yéménite d’Al-Moukalla, mardi, a visé des intérêts émiratis. Si les Émirats arabes unis sont un allié dans la lutte contre les Houthis, ils sont aussi un rival géopolitique et le principal sponsor d’un mouvement séparatiste qui inquiète de plus en plus Riyad.

title: À Gaza, la crise humanitaire fait rage malgré le cessez-le-feu
summary: Dans la bande de Gaza, le cessez-le-feu en vigueur depuis le 10 octobre n'a pas mis fin à la crise humanitaire. Frappée par la malnutrition et ne recevant qu'une aide au compte-gouttes, la population endure son troisième hiver dans un territoire dévasté.

title: Yémen : après un ultimatum de l'Arabie saoudite, les Émirats annoncent le retrait de leurs forces
summary: Les Émirats arabes unis, soutien du mouvement séparatiste du Conseil de transition du Sud (STC), ont annoncé mardi le retrait de leurs forces restantes au Yémen, après que l'Arabie saoudite, alliée du gouvernement yéménite, a fixé un délai de 24 heures pour leur départ.

title: Le Hamas confirme la mort de son porte-parole Abou Obeida, revendiquée par Israël en août
summary: La mort d'Abou Obeida, porte-parole de la branche armée du Hamas depuis 2002, a été confirmée lundi par les Brigades al-Qassam, plusieurs mois après qu'Israël avait affirmé l'avoir tué. Il avait notamment annoncé les attaques du 7-Octobre. Un nouveau responsable reprend son nom et ses fonctions.

title: À Mar-a-Lago, Benjamin Netanyahu et Donald Trump mettent en garde le Hamas et l'Iran
summary: Le Premier ministre israélien s'est entretenu, lundi, à Mar-a-Lago, en Floride, avec le président américain. Les deux hommes ont mis en garde l'Iran contre toute tentative de réarmement et le Hamas en cas de non-respect du plan de paix pour Gaza. Il s'agit de la cinquième entrevue aux États-Unis entre les deux dirigeants depuis le retour à la Maison Blanche de Donald Trump.

title: Syrie : plusieurs personnes tuées dans une manifestation d'alaouites après l'attaque d'une mosquée
summary: Des milliers de manifestants appartenant à la communauté alaouite sont descendus dans la rue, dimanche, en Syrie, deux jours après l'attaque d'une de leurs mosquées qui a fait huit morts. Au moins trois personnes ont été tuées et des dizaines de personnes ont été blessées lors d'affrontements entre les différents groupes de manifestants et les forces de l'ordre.

title: Iran-Israël : le récit des 12 jours de guerre ouverte
summary: Du 13 au 24 juin 2025, Israël et l’Iran s'affrontent à coups de missiles et de frappes aériennes. Un conflit qui affaiblit considérablement la République islamique, touche durement certaines villes israéliennes et dont l'issue est décidée dans le Bureau ovale. En lettres capitales sur son réseau social, c'est Donald Trump qui lui a donné son nom : “La guerre des douze jours”. Récit.

title: Yémen : l'Arabie saoudite menace les séparatistes d'une action militaire
summary: "Dans le but de protéger la vie des civils", l'Arabie saoudite a menacé, samedi, d'une action militaire les séparatistes du Conseil de transition du sud au Yémen. Riyad, qui soutient le gouvernement yéménite, a appelé le STC à se retirer "pacifiquement" des provinces récemment conquises de Hadramout et Mahra.

title: Syrie : huit morts lors d'un attentat dans une mosquée à Homs
summary: Une explosion a frappé vendredi une mosquée située dans un secteur alaouite de la ville de Homs en Syrie, faisant huit morts, dernière attaque en date visant cette communauté musulmane minoritaire dans le pays.

title: Yémen : 15 000 combattants yéménites soutenus par l'Arabie saoudite massés à la frontière
summary: L'Arabie saoudite a été accusée vendredi par les séparatistes yéménites d'avoir bombardé leurs positions dans l'est du pays, un territoire dont ils se sont emparés le mois dernier. Quelque 15 000 militaires soutenus par l'Arabie saoudite sont également regroupés à la frontière depuis le début du mois, sans ordre d'avancer, a annoncé un responsable militaire.

title: EN DIRECT, guerre en Ukraine : « l’agression menée par la Russie fait partie d’un plan visant l’ensemble de l’Europe », assure Friedrich Merz, qui appelle le continent à s’affirmer
summary: Dans ses vœux pour le Nouvel An, le chancelier allemand a souligné que la guerre « terrible » qui fait rage aux portes de l’Europe représentait une menace directe pour la liberté et la sécurité du continent.

title: En Iran, un mouvement social de commerçants secoue le régime
summary: L’effondrement de la valeur du rial amplifie les difficultés économiques des détaillants, qui ont manifesté dans plusieurs grandes villes. Certaines universités de Téhéran se sont aussi mobilisées. Aux protestations d’ordre économique se mêlent des slogans plus politiques.

title: Taïwan affirme que la Chine retire ses navires des alentours de l’île, après deux jours d’exercices militaires de grande ampleur
summary: Pékin s’est emporté mercredi contre les pays qui ont émis des critiques « irresponsables » après ses manœuvres militaires autour de Taïwan.

title: Eurostar annonce une reprise du trafic dans le tunnel sous la Manche, et prévoit d’« assurer tous ses services » mercredi
summary: L’entreprise avertit toutefois de possibles perturbations, à la suite d’un double incident technique survenu mardi dans le tunnel.

title: La Thaïlande libère dans le cadre du cessez-le-feu 18 soldats cambodgiens capturés en juillet
summary: Bangkok et Phnom Penh ont annoncé, le 27 décembre, une trêve immédiate dans leur conflit frontalier.

title: Le meilleur de l’actualité scientifique de 2025 : xénogreffe, Neandertal et le feu, le mythe du mâle alpha, une comète venue d’ailleurs…
summary: Retrouvez en images les temps forts de l’actualité scientifique et médicale, ainsi que les personnalités qui ont laissé leur empreinte sur l’année écoulée.

title: En Chine, une peinture de la dynastie Ming donnée à un grand musée refait surface dans une vente aux enchères
summary: Une pièce maîtresse du Musée de Nankin, offerte par la famille d’un collectionneur, s’est trouvée récemment dans une vente aux enchères, embrasant le débat sur la gestion des collections publiques.

title: Guerre en Ukraine : après la supposée attaque de drones contre une résidence de Poutine, les preuves introuvables
summary: En dépit des accusations formulées par la Russie, aucune frappe n’a été documentée autour du domaine présidentiel, situé à 400 kilomètres au nord-ouest de Moscou. Kiev, qui dénonce un « mensonge », y voit un prétexte du Kremlin pour intensifier ses frappes et durcir sa position dans les négociations de paix menées par les Etats-Unis.

title: Au Venezuela, la CIA cible un site portuaire, nouvelle escalade de la campagne de Donald Trump contre le régime de Nicolas Maduro
summary: Selon la presse américaine, les Etats-Unis auraient mené une attaque de drone contre un entrepôt utilisé par le gang Tren de Aragua pour stocker de la drogue. Il s’agit de la première frappe américaine confirmée sur le sol vénézuélien.

title: « Nous avons vécu l’enfer » : au Soudan, la lente résurrection de Khartoum
summary: Guerre au Soudan, une nation prise au piège (2/6). Principale ligne de front pendant deux ans, la capitale a été reprise en mars par l’armée régulière. Depuis, la ville tente de renaître de ses cendres.

title: Saint-Sylvestre 2015 à Cologne : retour sur une nuit qui a traumatisé l’Allemagne
summary: Plus d’un millier de femmes ont été agressées sexuellement dans la nuit du 31 décembre 2015 par des groupes d’hommes, pour la plupart originaires d’Afrique du Nord et du Moyen-Orient, provoquant un débat sur la politique d’accueil des réfugiés. Dix ans après, les victimes considèrent qu’elles ont été instrumentalisées et restent, pour certaines, profondément marquées par cette soirée.

title: Municipales 2026 : les maires circonspects face à l’appel de l’armée à préparer les Français au combat
summary: La demande du général Fabien Mandon, chef d’état-major des armées, à « accepter de perdre ses enfants », n’a pas convaincu beaucoup d’élus. Pour autant, ces derniers ne nient pas le risque d’une guerre à venir et mettent en place d’autres moyens pour faire vivre le lien entre l’armée et la population.

title: Israeli settlers plough Palestinian land near Jericho, destroy crops in Jordan Valley
summary:
Israeli settlers plough Palestinian land near Jericho, destroy crops in Jordan Valley

Bedouin rights organisation al-Baidar, on Wednesday, said that Israeli settlers ploughed Palestinian lands in the Shallal al-Auja area north of Jericho, as part of plans to expand the new outpost, Wafa news reported. 

The report said that settlers also destroyed agricultural crops in the community of al-Farisiya in the northern Jordan Valley, northeast of the occupied West Bank.

title: Israel conducted two strikes inside Lebanon, local media reports
summary:
Israel conducted two strikes inside Lebanon, local media reports

The Israeli military on Wednesday bombed a building in Houla and carried out a drone strike in Aita al Shaab, in southern Lebanon, local media reported.

The Israeli army has not yet commented on the strikes. 

مسيرة للاحتلال تستهدف جرافة بقنبلة في بلدة عيتا الشعب جنوب لبنان. pic.twitter.com/1Giuwe98VW

— شبكة قدس الإخبارية (@qudsn) December 31, 2025

title: West Bank: Israeli forces kill Palestinian by firing at vehicle, set house ablaze
summary:
West Bank: Israeli forces kill Palestinian by firing at vehicle, set house ablaze

The General Authority for Civil Affairs on Tuesday evening said that Israeli forces killed a Palestinian man by opening fire on a vehicle between the towns of Awarta and Einabus, south of Nablus in the occupied West Bank. 

The officials said that their teams are following up on receiving the body of the 20-year-old Qais Sami Jasser Allan after he was shot. 

Palestinian news media reported that Israeli forces also set a house on fire by firing bombs in the town of Aboud, northwest of Ramallah, in the central West Bank.

The Palestinian Red Crescent Society said that four Palestinians were wounded by Israeli army gunfire on their vehicle in the same area.

title: Israeli army reports nearly 21,000 attacks during multi-front operations in 2025
summary:
Israeli army reports nearly 21,000 attacks during multi-front operations in 2025

The Israeli army spokesperson on Wednesday said that as part of ongoing military operations on several fronts, the forces carried out attacks on approximately 20,900 targets in 2025. 

The announcement comes as the military carried out a combing operation on the border with Lebanon near the town of Arab al Aramsheh.

title: Israeli attacks reported near Khan Younis, Bureij and Maghazi refugee camps
summary:
Israeli attacks reported near Khan Younis, Bureij and Maghazi refugee camps

Israeli forces on Wednesday launched an artillery bombardment accompanied by heavy gunfire from military vehicles east of Khan Younis in the southern Gaza Strip, Palestinian media reported. 

Military vehicles also opened fire on the southeastern areas of the Bureij and Maghazi refugee camps in the central Gaza Strip, as Israeli escalation of violence continued on several fronts.

Injuries were also reported from the Halawa camp, west of Jabalia city, northern Gaza Strip.

title: Israeli forces kill Palestinian child in Gaza as demolitions continue
summary:
Israeli forces kill Palestinian child in Gaza as demolitions continue

Israeli forces on Wednesday killed a Palestinian child, Dana Hussein Ahmed Muqat, by firing live bullets in the Zarqa area, northeast of Gaza City, local media reported. 

Arab48 reported that the Israeli forces also demolished several residential buildings east of Gaza City, where the military also opened fire. 

Israeli artillery shelling was also reported from northeast of the Bureij refugee camp in the central Gaza Strip.

title: Child killed, three wounded in Gaza tent collapse amid Israeli operations
summary:
Child killed, three wounded in Gaza tent collapse amid Israeli operations

A Palestinian child was killed while three others were wounded when a wall collapsed onto a tent for displaced people in Rafah, south of the Gaza Strip, local media reported. 

The report said that the Israeli army carried out seven simultaneous demolition operations in areas under its control north of Rafah.

Israeli helicopters also opened fire towards the city of Rafah, as part of the ongoing military escalation in the southern areas of Gaza.

title: Britain, Canada, Japan warn of severe Gaza humanitarian crisis
summary:
Britain, Canada, Japan warn of severe Gaza humanitarian crisis

Countries including Britain, Canada, Japan and several European nations on Wednesday issued a joint statement saying that civilians in Gaza are facing appalling conditions and called on Israel to let international NGOs function in the region.

The statement said that more than 1.3 million people in Gaza urgently need shelter, where "the complete collapse of the sewage infrastructure has left 740,000 people at risk of toxic flooding".

"We express our deep concern about the renewed deterioration of the humanitarian situation in Gaza, which remains catastrophic," the statement said. 

"We call on the Government of Israel to ensure that international NGOs are able to operate in Gaza in a sustainable manner," it added.

title: Morning update
summary:
Morning update

Good morning Middle East Eye readers. Here are the latest updates from Gaza, where Israel continues to violate the ceasefire more than two months after it came into effect:

  • In Gaza, Israeli helicopters opened fire towards the southern city of Rafah as part of the ongoing military escalation, where Israeli forces are using explosives to demolish residential buildings, and their helicopters are firing heavily. 

  • In Khan Younis, Israeli forces launched a heavy artillery bombardment accompanied by heavy gunfire from military vehicles.

  • In central Gaza, Israeli military vehicles opened fire on the southeastern areas of Bureij and Maghazi refugee camps, marking a continued escalation on several fronts.

  • Many people have been wounded from Israeli gunfire in Halawa camp, west of Jabalia city, northern Gaza Strip.

  • A joint statement was issued by Britain, Canada, Japan and several European countries saying that civilians in Gaza are facing appalling conditions and 1.3 million people are still in urgent need of shelter. They called on Israel to ensure that international NGOs can operate in Gaza, where the complete collapse of the sewage infrastructure has left 740,000 people at risk of toxic flooding.

  • The Israeli army said that it has carried out attacks on approximately 20,900 targets on various fronts during 2025, as part of ongoing military operations on several fronts. 

  • The Israeli army also announced that it had carried out a combing operation on the border with Lebanon near the town of Arab al Aramsheh.

title: Israeli soldiers sentenced to prison for vandalising Palestinian cars
summary:
Israeli soldiers sentenced to prison for vandalising Palestinian cars

The Israeli military sentenced soldiers from two regiments who vandalised cars belonging to Palestinians from the village of Deir Dibwan near Ramallah to prison, Haaretz reported on Wednesday. 

Squad commanders from the Paratrooper Brigade and a soldoer from the Binyamin Brigade entered the village on Saturday and vandalized vehicles there.

Squad commanders from the Paratrooper Brigade were sentenced to 30 days in prison, while the soldier from the Binyamin Brigade was sentenced to 20 days in prison.

Commanders involved in the incident will not be allowed to return to combat positions in the military according to the report.

title: Boeing to make up to 50 new F-15 fighter jets for Israel
summary:
Boeing to make up to 50 new F-15 fighter jets for Israel

The US Department of War on Monday revealed that Boeing had been awarded a nearly $8.6bn contract to make F-15 fighter jets for Israel. 

The deal was announced shortly after US President Donald Trump and Israeli Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu concluded a joint press conference in Palm Beach, Florida. 

The contract involves the "design, integration, instrumentation, test, production and delivery of 25 new F-15IA aircraft for the Israeli Air Force, with an option for an additional 25 F-15IA aircraft," according to a routine statement that lists the Pentagon's new contracts. 

A similar deal was signed in November 2024 at a cost of $5.2bn for 25 such aircraft for Israel. 

You can read more here.

title: Israel is targeting and arresting Palestinian fishermen who attempt to fish
summary:
Israel is targeting and arresting Palestinian fishermen who attempt to fish

Israel’s navy are continuing to target and arrest Palestinian fishermen in the sea off the coast of the Gaza Strip, Al Jazeera reported on Tuesday.

Fisherman told the broadcast network that they were struggling to feed their families given that fishing is their only source of livelihood.

title: Russia warns Israeli ‘hotheads’ to refrain from escalating tensions with Iran
summary: Moscow, IRNA – Russia has expressed serious concern over statements made during Israeli Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu’s visit to the United States regarding potential new military strikes against Iran, urging Israeli “hotheads” to refrain from escalating tensions with Iran.

title: Speaker Ghalibaf highlights Martyr Soleimani’s legacy in turning threats into opportunities
summary: Tehran, IRNA – Iran’s Parliament Speaker Mohammad Bagher Ghalibaf has described the ability to recognize opportunities within threats as the most prominent characteristic of the assassinated Lieutenant General Qassem Soleimani, stressing that his legacy and school of thought remain alive and instructive.

title: IRGC forces arrest terror-linked team in southeastern Iran
summary: Zahedan, IRNA – The Islamic Revolution Guards Corps (IRGC) forces have identified and arrested a team linked to terrorist groups in Saravan County, Sistan and Baluchestan Province.

title: Araghchi: Trump’s threats against Iran are gross violation of international law, UN Charter
summary: Tehran, IRNA – Foreign Minister Abbas Araghchi has described the recent threats by US President Donald Trump against the Islamic Republic of Iran as a gross violation of international law and the United Nations Charter, and called for clear and firm condemnation of these provocative statements by everyone.

title: Iran responds to Trump’s new threats in a letter to UNSC
summary: New York, IRNA – Iranian Ambassador and Permanent Representative to the UN Amir Saeid Iravani, following US President Donald Trump’s new threats against Iran, condemned “these reckless threats” in a letter to the Security Council and the UN Secretary-General.

title: Lebanese foreign minister calls for new chapter in ties with Iran
summary: Tehran, IRNA – Lebanese Foreign Minister Youssef Rajji has called for opening a new page in relations with Tehran.

title: Iran’s foreign minister calls on Trump to defy Netanyahu and resume talks
summary: Tehran, IRNA - Foreign Minister Abbas Araghchi has called on US President Donald Trump to resist Israeli pressure and seize a “brief window of opportunity” to restart nuclear negotiations with Tehran based on mutual respect.

title: Iranian, Russian presidents review bilateral ties over phone
summary: Tehran, IRNA – Presidents of Iran and Russia held a telephone conversation on Tuesday to review the latest state of bilateral relations and the progress in implementing joint agreements between the two countries.

title: Iran’s Atomic Energy Organization unveils three major nuclear achievements
summary: Tehran, IRNA - The Atomic Energy Organization of Iran (AEOI) says it has registered three new nuclear achievements, including the launch of the country’s first fully indigenous industrial accelerator, the start of advanced production of Carbon-13, and the reactivation of a cyclotron for radiopharmaceutical production.

title: Pezeshkian warns of ‘severe’ response to any attack after Trump’s threat
summary: Tehran, IRNA – President Masoud Pezeshkian said on Tuesday that Iran would deliver a harsh and deterrent response to any act of aggression.

title: Iran designates Canada’s navy as terrorist organization in retaliatory move
summary: Tehran, IRNA – Iran has designated the Royal Canadian Navy as a terrorist organization in a reciprocal response to Ottawa’s earlier decision to list Iran’s IRGC as a terrorist entity, the Foreign Ministry said on Tuesday.

title: Relief work underway as floods and snow leave 9 dead across Iran
summary: Tehran, IRNA – Severe weather including floods, heavy snowfall and blizzards across Iran over the past 72 hours has killed at least nine people and injured 15 others, while two people remain missing, the Iranian Red Crescent said on Tuesday.

title: Harsh words, firm stance: How Iran reacted to Trump threats?
summary: TEHRAN, Dec. 31 (MNA) – Iran’s reaction to the latest US–Israeli threats was clear, strong, and coordinated. High-ranking Iranian officials emphasized that Iran’s defensive and nuclear capabilities are sovereign rights and will never be compromised.

title: Russia reacts to renewed US, Israeli threats against Iran
summary: TEHRAN, Dec. 31 (MNA) – Russian Foreign Ministry Spokesman Maria Zakharova has reacted to the recent threats made by the US President and Israeli regime's prime minister against Iran.

title: Iran warns against US threats, reaffirms full preparedness
summary: TEHRAN, Dec. 31 (MNA) – Iranian Foreign Minister Abbas Araghchi has warned that the Islamic Republic of Iran will not hesitate to deliver a decisive and regret-inducing response to any act of aggression, citing recent threats made by Donald Trump.

title: Tehran slams Netanyahu’s decades of anti-Iran rhetoric
summary: TEHRAN, Dec. 31 (MNA) – Iran’s Foreign Ministry spokesperson Esmail Baghaei has reacted to a CNN video compilation highlighting decades of repeated claims by Israeli Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu regarding Iran’s nuclear program.

title: Terrorist cell dismantled in southeast Iran
summary: TEHRAN, Dec. 31 (MNA) – A terrorist cell linked to hostile and terrorist groups and involved in plotting attacks against security forces has been identified and arrested in southeast Iran.

title: Three powerful explosions heard in Lebanon
summary: TEHRAN, Dec. 31 (MNA) – Media sources report that three explosions were heard near a newly established Israeli military base in southern Lebanon.

title: Front pages of Iran’s English dailies on December 31
summary: TEHRAN, Dec. 31 (MNA) – Here are the front pages of Iran's English language dailies on Wednesday, December 31.

title: You’ll never defeat us in Iran, Araghchi tells Trump
summary: TEHRAN, Dec. 30 (MNA) – "You’ll never defeat us in Iran, President Trump: but with real talks, we can both win," according to a contribution by the Iranian Foreign Minister to Western media on Tuesday.

title: US sanctions 10 people, entities linked to Iran, Venezuela
summary: TEHRAN, Dec. 30 (MNA) –The US Treasury Department announced on Tuesday new sanctions on 10 individual and entities for tgheir alleged links to Iran and Venezuela.

title: UAE announces end to its military presence in Yemen
summary: TEHRAN, Dec. 30 (MNA) – The United Arab Emirates (UAE) announced an end to its military presence in Yemen on Tuesday amid rising tensions in the country’s south.

title: Venezuela air force destroyed 39 drug-carrying planes in 2025
summary: TEHRAN, Dec. 30 (MNA) –Venezuelan air force destroyed 39 drug-carrying planes in 2025, bringing the total number of such planes to 430 since the adoption of the anti-drug law, Venezuelan President Nicolas Maduro has said.

title: Clean air in Tehran
summary: TEHRAN, Dec. 30 (MNA) – The people in the Iranian capital of Tehran witnessed clear air after the blowing of cold winter wind and snow, as well as rainfall in the early hours of morning on Tuesday.

title: تعریف ۷.۵ همت طرح جدید سرمایه‌گذاری در لرستان
summary: خرم‌آباد - معاون اقتصادی استانداری لرستان از تعریف ۷.۵ همت طرح جدید سرمایه‌گذاری در این استان خبر داد.

title: سند جامع مدیریت زنجیره صنایع‌دستی با تصویب هیئت وزیران ابلاغ شد
summary: سند جامع مدیریت زنجیره صنایع‌دستی با هدف سامان‌دهی و تقویت این حوزه با تصویب هیئت وزیران ابلاغ شد.

title: بدهی فدراسیون فوتبال به شستا پرداخت شد/ سند به اسم فدراسیون برگشت خورد
summary: با اعلام خزانه‌دار فدراسیون فوتبال موضوع بدهی به شرکت شستا پرداخت شد و اسناد این نهاد به فدراسیون بازگشت.

title: آتش‌سوزی منزل مسکونی در مشهد؛ یک نفر مصدوم شد
summary: مشهد- مدیر روابط عمومی سازمان آتش نشانی مشهد، از وقوع یک آتش‌سوزی در یک منزل مسکونی خبر داد که به مصدومیت یک نفر انجامید.

title: تبعات بی اعتنایی به تاریخ انقضای داروها
summary: سرپرست بازرسی فنی و نظارت اداره کل داروی سازمان غذا و دارو، درباره تبعات بی اعتنایی به تاریخ انقضای داروها هشدار داد.

title: گرمای شدید موجب قطعی گسترده برق در آرژانتین شد
summary: در آستانه سال نو میلادی، گرمای شدید موجب قطعی گسترده برق در آرژانتین شد.
